abstract.p: Photos of ankle-length, full-skirted dance dresses seen in New York City (On the Street column)1

block.p: The ankle-length, full-skirted dance dress emerged during the spring party season as an alternative to the floor-sweeping ball gown and long, slinky dresses ending in trains -- both impractical in a modern society. The new length, from low calf to above the ankle, is accentuated with ankle-strap, high-heel sandals. In 1950, the same idea was popular at opulent balls. Some women, below and right, are wearing dresses from this period; others, left, contemporary versions of the look. It's all part of fashion's looking back to step forward.
